msDesc.head: Theological texts and sermons; Germany (Eberbach), 12th century, beginning or middle

msItem.author: Ps.-Haimo of Halberstadt
msItem.title: De uarietate librorum
msItem.incipit: De futura enim uita plus credendum est
msItem.explicit: cum Patre et Spiritu sancto, per infinita vivit et regnat saecula. Amen.
msItem.note: Begins with a table of contents. Fol. 1 a stub, recto with Eberbach ownership inscription.

msItem.title: Disputatio dives et pauperis
msItem.incipit: Utinam ad desideratas aliquando merear peruenire
msItem.explicit: volumus habere uirtutes, non amittere uitia, quod fieri non potest.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Collectio de IV virtutibus caritatis
msItem.note: See R. Étaix, 'L'ancienne collection de sermons attribués à saint Augustin De quattuor virtutibus caritatis', Revue Bénédictine 95 (1985), 44–59, this ms. listed p. 48.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De quattuor uirtutibus caritatis
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber sancti Augustini de quatuor virtutibus karitatis
msItem.incipit: Desiderium karitatis vestrae

msItem.author: Caesarius of Arles (?)
msItem.title: Sermo 63
msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo eiusdem sancti Augustii de penitentia
msItem.incipit: Admoneo fratres in conspectu Dei timori vestro
msItem.note: CCL 103 (1953) 272–274; PL 67.1082–1083: Homilia 19. Also transmitted as Augustine, Sermo 393, de paenitentibus, (PL 39.1713–1715); Ps.-Ambrose, De paenientia ex dictis s. Augustini. (see Drobner, Augustinianum, 55:2 (2015) p. 525).

msItem.author: Petrus Chrysologus (?) (Ps.-Augustine)
msItem.title: (serm. 6)
msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo sancti Augustini de ieiunio et oratione
msItem.incipit: Aduersus demonum nequitiam que Dominus arma ostendit, debemus utique retinere
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo sancti Augustini de ieiunio et oratione

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: In die Paschae (serm. 224)
msItem.incipit: Hodierna die qui baptizati sunt in Christo et renati, alloquamur eos et uos in eis

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Enarratio in Psalmos
msItem.incipit: Mors autem uera quam non timent homines
msItem.note: CCSL 38 (1956) 565.10–568.75 (see Drobner, Augustinianum, 55:2 (2015) p. 525). Römer (1972) p. 381.

msItem.author: Augustine (?)
msItem.title: De dilectione inimicorum (sermo dubius 386)
msItem.rubric: In hoc libello increpatur dolosus et iracundus, ut agnoscat quadam? iram tenuerit proximo suo, peccata sua sibi dimitti non posse sed potius augerit
msItem.incipit: Intendite fratres mei ad karitatem, quam sic laudat scriptura diuina ut nihil ei coaequet.

msItem.author: Ps.-Maximus of Turin (Ps.-Augustine)
msItem.title: De quadragesima (serm. 18)
msItem.rubric: Sermo sancti Augustini de quadragesimae abstinentiae
msItem.incipit: Omne uitae nostrae tempus stadium quoddam debemus putare uirtutum et ad caeleste brauium tota uirtute contendere

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Sermo de cogitationibus (sermo ad fratres in eremo 76)
msItem.incipit: Primum quidem cogitationibus malis repugnandum est ut cum aliquid carnale

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De illo qui diu iram in pectore retinet et non uult humiliari (sermo ad fratres in eremo 73)
msItem.rubric: Sermo sancti Augustini ubi increpat qui diu iram in pectore retinet et non uult humiliari
msItem.incipit: Omnis homo qui uult de inimico suo uindicari, prouocat se uindictam Dei

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Sermo de reddendis decimis (serm. Mai 73)
msItem.incipit: Scriptum est fratres Domini est terra et plenitudo eius. Serui Domini pariter sumus et coloni
msItem.note: PL 47.1237–1238; Noua Patrum Bibliotheca I.142–144; CPL 372a.73

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Sermo 395 (abbrev.)
msItem.rubric: Sancti Augustini de futura uita cogitatio
msItem.incipit: Fratres karissimi, quod audiuimus dici ut sursum corda habeamus
msItem.note: PL 39.1716–1717; cf. Ps.-Augustine, Ad fratres in eremo (serm. 74) (PL 40.1358). (see Drobner, Augustinianum, 55:2 (2015) p. 526).

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Sermo 211 (part)
msItem.rubric: Sermo sancti Augustini de oratione dominica
msItem.incipit: Fratres, diebus istis quos agimus obseruationem uitae nostrae

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Ad fratres in eremo (serm. 75)
msItem.incipit: Audite itaque qui estis in populo et stulti aliquando sapite

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Sermo de pace (serm. app. 61)
msItem.incipit: Felices pacifici quoniam filii Dei uocabuntur. Meritum christianae uirtutis uilescit in cunctis

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Serm. app. 56
msItem.incipit: Quem enim diligit Dominus, corripit, flagellat autem omnem filium quem recipit. Ad hoc flagellat ut corrigat, ad hoc autem corrigat, ut Patri, id est Deo, dignum exhibeat

msItem.author: Peter Chrysologus (Ps.-Augustine)
msItem.title: Sermo 145
msItem.rubric: Sermo sancti Augustini De natituitate domini nostri Iesu Christi
msItem.incipit: Audistis fratres quemadmodum nobis hodie beatus euangelista

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De sobrietate et castitate
msItem.incipit: Cum mortalium mutabiles mentes uel bonis uel malis

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: Admonitio contra carnis superbiam (Ep. supp. 60)
msItem.rubric: Tractatus sancti Augustini de carne superba
msItem.incipit: Ad te manum meam extendo quem sentio in timore Dei portare uexillum. Ad te me conuerto

msItem.author: Ps.-Chrysostom
msItem.title: Sermo in coena Domini (CPL 937)
msItem.incipit: In hodiernum conuiuium qui solemni frequentia conuenistis

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Sermones de passione domini (serm. Mai 28)
msItem.incipit: Euangelicae series lectionis qua per ordinem passionis dominicae gloriam didicistis credo quod
msItem.note: Ed. PLS 2.1126–1128; CPL 372a.28; = Ps. Chrysostom, Collectio Armentarii (Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal 175; cf. CPL 916), serm. 3

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Sermones de passione domini (serm. Mai 32)
msItem.incipit: Lectio sancti euangelii docet nos quemadmodum multis peccata sua Domino confitentibus cito possit uenia promereri
msItem.note: Ed. PLS 2.1130–32; CPL 372a.32; = Ps. Chrysostom, Collectio Armentarii (Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal 175; cf. CPL 916), serm. 7

msItem.author: Ps.-Severian of Gabala
msItem.title: Sermo de duobus latronibus
msItem.incipit: In cruce Dominus Christus pendebat, iudei blasphemabant, principes subsannabant. Latro confitebatur Domini

msItem.author: Ps.-Chrysostom
msItem.incipit: Hodierna die, fratres, Dominus noster pependit in cruce, cuius festiuitatem celebrantes redempti cognoscimus
msItem.note: See Etaix, p. 47: made up of extracts from CPG 4338 and CPG 4728.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Serm. 97 de pace
msItem.incipit: Domini est ista uox Pacem meam do uobis, pacem dimitto uobis. De pace dicturi prius que sint pacis commoda audiamus
msItem.explicit: ut cum illo in aeterna beatitudine vivere possimus. Amen.

msItem.author: Ps.-Chrysostom
msItem.title: Sermo in psalmum 50 de compunctione
msItem.rubric: Sermo s. Iohannis episcopi. De compunctione cordis
msItem.incipit: Rogat Dauid ut multum ab iniquitatem saluetur. Quod ergo pro hoc munus intulit

msItem.author: Severinus episcopus
msItem.title: Doctrina de sapientia
msItem.incipit: Dilige Deum, sapientiam disce, omnia cum mensura age
msItem.bibl: CPL 1153; PL 74.845–848; J. Schlecht, Doctrina xii Apostolorum. Die Apostellehre in der Liturgie, Freiburg, 1901, pp. 127–129

msItem.author: Ambrose (?)
msItem.title: Altercatio contra eos
msItem.rubric: Incipit altercatio Ambrosii contra eos, qui animam non confitentur esse facturam, aut extraducem esse dicunt
msItem.incipit: Sic enim dicit Deus: A me exiit spiritus et flatum omnem ego creo. Nonne hic est Deus qui uocauit puerum suum Iacob
msItem.note: CPL 170; printed in Caspari, Kirchenhistorische Anecdota, 1 (Christiania, 1888) pp. 227–29, and in PLS I.611–3.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De octo quaestionibus ex veteri Testamento
msItem.rubric: Sancti Augustini de octo questionibus ex ueteri testamento
msItem.incipit: Uenerabilem iusticiam non uiolat quis nisi libidine transgressus fuerit placitum societatis humanae

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De XII abusiuis saeculi
msItem.incipit: Duodecim abusiua sunt seculi. Hoc est sapiens sine operibus, senex sine religione
msItem.note: Ciprianus added by a later hand in the margin.

msItem.author: Ps.-Seneca
Ps.-Paul
msItem.title: Epistolae
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt epistolae Senecae ad Paulum, Paulique similiter ad eundem, quas sibi causa familiaritati et inuicem transmiserunt
msItem.incipit: Credo tibi Paule nunciatum
msItem.explicit: Tulit et priscorum etas macedonem philippi filium et post Darium et Dionisium nostra quoque

title.supplied: Centum et XIIII Sententiae patrum de officio verorum rectorum ecclesiae Dei siue Florilegium Sit autem rector

msItem.rubric: Fructuosi episcopi sermo, qualis esse debeat rector
msItem.incipit: Sit autem rector vir sanctus discretus gravis
msItem.explicit: meliora sunt vulnera diligentis quam fraudulenta oscula odientis
msItem.note: Pr. Cologne, 1531 (USTC 620935), etc.: a sixteenth-century note on fol. 95v refers to this edition.

Compilation from Fructuosus, Isidorus, Basilius, Gregorius, Benedictus abbas, Ambrosius, Jerome, Prosper, Cyprianus, Origen, Cassianus, Augustine, Johannes Constantinopolitanus, Chrysostomus, Caesarius. Also in Cologne, Stadtarchiv, GB fo 6, fols. 32r-59v (J. Vennebusch, Die theologischen Handschriften des Stadtarchivs Köln: Teil 1. Die Folio-Handschriften der Gymnasialbibliothek (1976), p. 12): there given the title 'Sententiarius patrum'.

listBibl.bibl: Thomas Falmagne, 'Les Cisterciens et les nouvelles formes d'organisation des florilèges aux 12e et 13e siècles', Archivum Latinitatis Medii Aevi, 55, 1997, 73-176 at 165

supportDesc.foliation: i-ii, 1–129 (fol. 1 is a stub, fol. 128 numbered erraneously 129)

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: Eberbach ex libris, 12th or 13th century (fol. 1r): Liber de Marie in eberbach. Excerpta patrum.

Augustine's Sermons identifiable as 'Mi. O 1' in the "Rheinischen Gesamtkatalog" from the 1470s (now Basel, Öffentliche Bibliothek der Universität, cod. F VI 53, pp. 1–28, on p. 22a/b): Palmer, p. 229.
Identifiable as b 26 in the Eberbach library catalogue of 1502.
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted by Tuija Ainonen and Matthew Holford (October 2020) from the following sources (with additional description of the contents and localization): Nigel F. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher: die mittelalterliche Bibliotheksgeschichte von Kloster Eberbach im Rheingau (Regensburg, 1998), pp. 229, 265, 294 [physical description, date, origin, provenance] H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885 [contents, acquisition]
Quarto Catalogue, cols. 265–6 Quarto Catalogue, p. 557 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 46

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Polonsky digitization project.
